title: How to start writing a chapter in a research paper - Quora

response.answer_text: Research papers are always the same: you answer the following questions, the length of your answer will depend on the field you are in. What is the question ? Why is it important? What is the state of affairs today? What is the part that is not known yet (where I’ll contribute)? What are my methods (or point of view)? What are my results? What do they mean? Conclusion.

One of the simplest methods I’ve found to get started is to begin with an outline. If you visit Tom March’s Thesis Builder you can answer a few simple questions and generate an outline that will get you started on writing your research paper. You can also check out my Practical Research (from idea to outline) that will walk you through creating an outline for your Introduction, Literature Review, and Methodology chapters. Hope that helps.
